Sentencas: Sodium bismuth titanate (NBT) based compounds have drawn significant attention because of high oxygen-ion conductivity which makes them a promising electrolyte candidate for solid oxide fuel cells.
Titulo: Long-term conductivity stability of acceptor-doped Na0.54Bi0.46TiO3-δ

Sentencas: The present work investigates the long-term conductivity stability of Na0.54Bi0.46TiO3-delta doped with acceptor cations such as Mg2+ and Ga3+ in 5% H-2-95% N-2 environment at 600 degrees C for 100 h. In-situ conductivity measurement performed using impedance spectroscopy indicates a significant loss in the conductivity in the first 20 h of ageing.
Titulo: Long-term conductivity stability of acceptor-doped Na0.54Bi0.46TiO3-δ

Sentencas: Following which, the conductivity appears to be stable for the next 20 h.
Titulo: Long-term conductivity stability of acceptor-doped Na0.54Bi0.46TiO3-δ

Sentencas: However, a sudden gain in conductivity is seen after 40 h of ageing in reducing conditions.
Titulo: Long-term conductivity stability of acceptor-doped Na0.54Bi0.46TiO3-δ

Sentencas: XRD analysis indicates the formation of Bi2O3 based compound which on further ageing decomposes to metallic Bi.
Titulo: Long-term conductivity stability of acceptor-doped Na0.54Bi0.46TiO3-δ

Sentencas: SEM analysis reveals the change in grain morphology during the course of ageing with the microstructure of 100 h aged sample is shown to contain several ruptured grains.
Titulo: Long-term conductivity stability of acceptor-doped Na0.54Bi0.46TiO3-δ

Sentencas: XPS results indicate the partial reduction of Ti4+ to Ti3+ which possibly leads to high n-type electronic conductivity in aged samples.
Titulo: Long-term conductivity stability of acceptor-doped Na0.54Bi0.46TiO3-δ

Sentencas: The conductivity loss is attributed to the decomposition of the perovskite phase while the sudden conductivity increase after 40 h of ageing is explained through n-type electronic conduction inside the NBT lattice.
Titulo: Long-term conductivity stability of acceptor-doped Na0.54Bi0.46TiO3-δ
